thread.title: RAB arrest eight from 'two gangs' including leaders in Dhaka schoolboy Adnan murder
thread.title_full: RAB arrest eight from 'two gangs' including leaders in Dhaka schoolboy Adnan murder

title: RAB arrest eight from 'two gangs' including leaders in Dhaka schoolboy Adnan murder
text:
RAB arrest eight from 'two gangs' including leaders in Dhaka schoolboy Adnan murder Staff Correspondent, bdnews24.com Published: 2017-02-08 10:52:25.0 BdST Updated: 2017-02-08 12:25:52.0 BdST Eighth grader Adnan Kabir died after he was attacked by 10 to 15 youths with sharp weapons at Dhaka's Uttara. Photo: Facebook This photo showing teenagers, armed with sticks and iron rods, was uploaded on the Facebook page of 'Disco Boys' before the attack on Adnan. Road 17 of Uttara’s Sector 13, where Adnan was attacked. Photo: Google Street View Previous Next The Rapid Action Battalion (RAB) say it have arrested eight persons belonging to 'two gangs' over the murder of schoolboy Adnan Kabir at Dhaka's Uttara. 
RAB media wing Director Mufit Mahmud Khan said the arrests were made during overnight raids on Tuesday in Dhaka and adjacent areas. 
Also read 
Uttara-based RAB 1 deputy chief Kazi Mohammad Shoyaib told bdnews24.com that the eight belong to 'Disco Boys' and 'Big Boss' gangs and that they include their leaders. 
The elite police unit, however, did not disclose their identities. 
Senior RAB officer Shoyaib said details will be provided in a media briefing later on Wednesday. 
The victim, an eighth grader from the Trust School and College in Uttara, was chased by 10 to 15 youths to Road 17 of Uttara’s Sector 13 on the evening of Jan 6. 
There, the killers hacked him with sharp weapons. Adnan died within an hour of being taken to a hospital. This photo showing teenagers, armed with sticks and iron rods, was uploaded on the Facebook page of 'Disco Boys' before the attack. Road 17 of Uttara’s Sector 13, where Adnan was attacked. Photo: Google Street View 

The case started with West Uttara Police Station by the victim’s father, Md Kabir Hossain, named nine and accused at least 12 more unidentified attackers who are between the age of 16 and 22. 
The nine named for murder are Nafis Md Alam aka Don, 19, Naimur Rahman Anik, 19, Sadaf Zakir, 16, Raihan Ahmed Setu, 19, Rabiul Islam, 18, Md Akhtaruzzaman Chhoton, 19, Ahmed Zian, 19, Khandker Shubho, 19 and Nazmus Sakib, 22. 
Police had arrested Don and Sadaf (Zakir) after the killing and interrogated them after securing remand from the court. Investigators said then that gang rivalry was behind the killing.
